languages.text: "Сей жрец речет истину подобно мудрому ткачу". {n}Кибелла принимается обновлять клинком едва заживший стигмат на руке.{/n} "Как мы принимаем благословения Неумирающего, так и боль нам должно принимать, ибо она приближает нас к Нему".

"This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."
languages.original_text: "Сей жрец речет истину подобно мудрому ткачу". {n}Кибелла принимается обновлять клинком едва заживший стигмат на руке.{/n} "Как мы принимаем благословения Неумирающего, так и боль нам должно принимать, ибо она приближает нас к Нему".

traits.locale_text: "This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

"This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

"This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

"This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

"This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

"This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

languages.text: «Este sacerdote dice la verdad, como un tejedor sabio». {n}Kibellah usa su hoja para reabrir una herida ritual reciente de su mano.{/n} «Tal como aceptamos las bendiciones del Inmortal, debemos aceptar el dolor que nos acerca a él».
languages.original_text: "This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

traits.locale_text: «Este sacerdote dice la verdad, como un tejedor sabio». {n}Kibellah usa su hoja para reabrir una herida ritual reciente de su mano.{/n} «Tal como aceptamos las bendiciones del Inmortal, debemos aceptar el dolor que nos acerca a él».

languages.text: 「この司祭は賢明な織り手のように真実を語っています」{n}キベラは最近治ったばかりの手の儀式の傷を刃物で開く。{/n}「不死の者の祝福を受け入れるように、痛みも受け入れなければならないのです」
languages.original_text: "This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

traits.locale_text: 「この司祭は賢明な織り手のように真実を語っています」{n}キベラは最近治ったばかりの手の儀式の傷を刃物で開く。{/n}「不死の者の祝福を受け入れるように、痛みも受け入れなければならないのです」

languages.text: “这位牧师如同贤明的织网者一样，道出了真理。”{n}绮贝菈掏出匕首，重新划开了手上前不久刚刚愈合的仪式伤口。{/n}“当我们接受不死之神的祝福时，我们也必须接受痛苦，因为痛苦会让我们更加接近祂。”
languages.original_text: "This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

traits.locale_text: “这位牧师如同贤明的织网者一样，道出了真理。”{n}绮贝菈掏出匕首，重新划开了手上前不久刚刚愈合的仪式伤口。{/n}“当我们接受不死之神的祝福时，我们也必须接受痛苦，因为痛苦会让我们更加接近祂。”

languages.text: "Dieser Priester spricht die Wahrheit, wie ein weiser Spinner." {n}Kibellah öffnet mit ihrer Klinge eine kürzlich verheilte Ritualwunde an ihrer Hand wieder.{/n} "So wie wir den Segen des Todlosen annehmen, müssen wir auch den Schmerz annehmen, denn er bringt uns näher zu Ihm."
languages.original_text: "This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

traits.locale_text: "Dieser Priester spricht die Wahrheit, wie ein weiser Spinner." {n}Kibellah öffnet mit ihrer Klinge eine kürzlich verheilte Ritualwunde an ihrer Hand wieder.{/n} "So wie wir den Segen des Todlosen annehmen, müssen wir auch den Schmerz annehmen, denn er bringt uns näher zu Ihm."

languages.text: « Ce prêtre parle aussi vrai qu'un tisseur avisé. {n}Kibellah se sert de sa lame pour rouvrir une plaie rituelle récemment cicatrisée, sur sa main.{/n} Tout comme nous acceptons les bénédictions de l'Immortel, il nous faut accepter la douleur, car elle nous rapproche de Lui. »
languages.original_text: "This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."

traits.locale_text: « Ce prêtre parle aussi vrai qu'un tisseur avisé. {n}Kibellah se sert de sa lame pour rouvrir une plaie rituelle récemment cicatrisée, sur sa main.{/n} Tout comme nous acceptons les bénédictions de l'Immortel, il nous faut accepter la douleur, car elle nous rapproche de Lui. »

languages.text: "Bu rahip, bilge bir dokurun yapacağı gibi hakikati söylüyor." {n}Kibellah, kılıcını kullanarak elindeki kısa süre önce iyileşen ayin yarasını yeniden açıyor.{/n} "Ölmeyen'in lütuflarını kabul ederken acıyı da kabul etmeliyiz. Zira acı, bizi O'na yaklaştırır."
languages.original_text: "This priest speaks the truth as a wise spinner would." {n}Kibellah uses her blade to reopen a recently healed ritual wound on her hand.{/n} "As we accept the Undying One's blessings, so must we accept pain, for it brings us closer to Him."
